Fame City

// Simulation of evolution of culture

Fame City is a simulation of a speculative world in which everyone will become famous, at some point. The project explores the present day mass obsession with celebrities and the relationship with the city that celebrities and paparazzi co-inhabit.

Unity3D Simulation

A Unity3D player browser plugin for Safari and Firefox is required to see the simulation.

Year 2015
Mentor Tim Durfee, Ben Hooker
Role Designer


What was going on?

The paparazzi look for and follows the celebrities around the city. The celebrities can take refuge in the cylindrical safe zones, where their celebrity status will be hidden. The AI of the paparazzi are programmed not to enter the safe zones, but surprisingly, some still find themselves in there, usually due to collision with other people, or due to inertia, when they move too fast. Also unexpected to me is the effect of the city's urban planning on the movement of the inhabitants. As the paparazzi does not know where the celebrities are going, (they calculate the nearest route only to their current location,) their stalking behavior is reduced in a congested city, but improved in open spaces. The phenomenon is opposite to what we normally expect, where open spaces such as a city square commonly imply more surveillance and less stalking.

The Culture of Fame as Commodities

Specifically in the last decade, the phenomenon that an average person suddenly rising to fame, through intense media exposure and speedy information relay on the internet has became ubiquitous. It is a phenomenon uniquely difficult to evaluate for all the implications of our character and culture, and thus interesting to consider in a piece of speculative design.

Although virtual in the sense that the city and the crowds are fully generated, the city is a realistic, physical manifestation of the culture of this world where celebrities are treated as commodities. While we observe an obsessive trend to follow celebrities on Twitter and news, there is also very little concern raised about the actual well-being of these people of fame. This absurd, highly objectifying culture is explicitly portrayed in the simulation as we watch the paparazzi of Fame City follows a celebrity with precision and intelligence. Smart behaviors such as obstacle avoidance and increasing speed upon sighting a target all creates an illusion of intent. While situated in an imaginative world, the project aims to highlight the disturbingly inhumane quality in this widely prevalent human behavior.

Fame Tower

 Fame Tower in action

The tower is a modified the Safe Zones that completes the ecology of this world by filling in the missing link of how does a person becomes famous. The tower is legislatively inhibited to paparazzi, just like the Safe Zones, but practically still permeable. The tower transforms a paparazzi intruders to celebrities by projecting their faces up high for everyone to see for a brief 15 seconds. It is effectively a physical translation of the function of mass media. Fame Tower aims to empower the architecture of the city, so as to grant the city an active role in transforming its inhabitants.

from Shixie. 2015
